item.title: About
item.description: Bri Watson B.M. (“Bri”) Watson is a white queer crip & nonbinary settler living in Tsleil-Waututh. They are a PhD. student at the University of British Columbia’s iSchool where they focus on focusing on queer nomenclature, histories of information, and equitable cataloging in GLAMS (galleries, archives, libraries, museums, and special collections). Additionally, they are the Director of HistSex.com, a free and open access resource for the history of sexuality. They serve as the Archivist-Historian of the Consensual Non-Monogamies Taskforce of the American Psychological Association and contribute to Homosaurus, an international linked data vocabulary for LGBTQ terms.

item.title: Definitions
item.description: Confused about terms? This page a work in progress… Glossary CritCat is short for “critical cataloging,” a movement of cultural heritage workers who work to bring social justice, radical empathy, and outreach work into their everyday practice. Recognizing the need for information maintenence and care, critical catalogers read cataloging and classification systems with an eye for catalogic warrant, reflecting on the potential harm or benefit of each term on the catalog, users, and the library community as a whole.
